intro: Strobilanthes tetraptera, commonly known as the four-winged strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive four-winged bracts that enclose its flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. It produces small, tubular flowers that are often clustered in dense inflorescences. Due to its unique morphology and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
